characters: INT. KUMAIL'S PARENTS DINING ROOM- MOMENTS LATER
IT'S NOT OKAY THIS IS YOUR LIFE". I
INT. BEREAVEMENT ROOM- MOMENTS LATER, (SUNDAY MORNING)
INT. HOSPITAL WAITING ROOM- MONDAY MORNING
INT. EMILY'S ICU ROOM- NEXT MORNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail walks into the comedy club as MARY is doing a set on stage. CHRIS intercepts Kumail as he walks backstage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no bad crowds dude. Only bad comedians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You complain about the crowd like all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but that's when they're really bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So like ninety percent of the time, they're really bad? 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you just watch and give me notes tonight? If we both give each other notes, I think it would be helpful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your notes are just to add more "fucks" into the bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck's a funny word. Soft on the top and it's hard on the end. Mary walks off the stage and sits on the couch next to CJ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was truly horrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that was great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he didn't even crack a smile. I thought I was gonna puke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob Dalavan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Bob Dalaban?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob Dalavan - works for the Montreal Comedy Festival, you fuckin' doof. Don't you want to get noticed? Move to LA? Hang out with Elijah Wood and shit. ANDY DODD, the coked-up emcee, appears out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's on stage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Dodd rushes on stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He might have been doing cocaine. 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he doing cocaine recreationally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A true cokehead. Dodd jumps up on stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now before I bring up the next guy, you guys know tonight is Jell-o Shot Tuesday! Whooo!! And we all know what happens after eight Jell-o shots. We urinate all over ourselves and puke. Okay, so I'm going to bring up the next comic. You know this man. Chris slaps his own face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confidence. Poise. Smile. Dodd (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it up for Mister Chris Jones! Chris walks on stage. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's like if a serial killer fucked an inspirational speaker. CJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's like Daniel Day Lewis except he sucks. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just bought a laser printer. Printed out like six lasers so far. CJ, Kumail, and Mary watching Chris' set. Andy Dodd saunters backstage. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Dodd. Dalavan's in the crowd tonight. Could I do ten? DODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Five minutes. You put out chairs, you get five minutes. You know the deal. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon man. I'll double it up next time. 4 DODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Dodd walks back into the bathroom. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do in there? DODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm making up next week's schedule. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CJ is on stage crushing it. Kumail and Mary watch from the wings. CJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in bed with my girlfriend and I was trying to mansplain to her that, you know, we are on one little rock orbiting a star in a galaxy of a billion stars in a universe full of a billion galaxies, so I forgot your birthday. Who gives a shit? You are cosmically over reacting to this. Honestly you are being super selfish. You're right, but you're selfish. Kumail looks out at the crowd. Dalavan enjoys CJ's set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail puts a RECORDER on his stool, presses RECORD and starts his set. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Have you guys heard of this new drug cocktail called cheese? I saw these news reports so I looked up what cheese is and cheese is a mixture. Cheese is Tylenol PM and heroin. So really, it's heroin. Heroin's doing the heavy lifting. Just do the heroin, it's very powerful. You already have heroin. Kumail looks to see if Bob Dalavan is laughing. He's not there. He's in the back talking to CJ. Fuck. 5 KUMAIL (CONT'D) (pushing through)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Pakistan in the house?! O.S. A WOMAN "Woo-hoos!" Kumail looks out at the crowd and sees EMILY, late 20's, white with a streak of blue in her hair. She sits at a table with a few friends. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not from Pakistan. I would have noticed you. She smiles. Crowded bar scene after the show. Kumail, Chris, Mary and CJ hang out at the bar. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just gave you Montreal? Like you don't have to showcase or audition or anything? CJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was too easy. Like I wanted to struggle. I wanted a story to be able to tell on talk shows and instead, like, you guys don't know how hard it is not to struggle. It's a struggle succeeding effortlessly. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he say anything about me? CJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about me? CJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both of you. He said, those guys performed... MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I truly hate you, actually. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all hate you. Kumail walks over to Emily and her friend JESSIE, talks loud over the music. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. 6 EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, my name is Kumail. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. We know. JESSIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We saw you perform. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Now that the niceties are out of the way, I have to tell you that when you yelled at me, it threw me off. You really shouldn't heckle comedians. It's so rude. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't heckle you. I just woo-hooed you. It was supportive. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that's a common misconception. Yelling anything at a comedian is considered heckling. Heckling doesn't have to be negative. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if I yelled out "You're amazing in bed," that would be a heckle? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It'd be an accurate heckle. JESSIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Goodbye! Jessie walks away. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go! You scared my friend off now. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily. Kumail writes Emily's name in Urdu on a napkin. 7 KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to show you something, Emily. This is your name in Urdu. Emily picks up the napkin, looks at it. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. Does this move work? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had some minor success with it. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily and Kumail are still at the bar. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you came to a comedy show with your friends? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're all grad students at U of C. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you studying at grad school? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I study psychology. I'm going to be a therapist. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh so you're gonna sit on a couch and ask people, "how did that make you feel?" EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eventually. Right now I'm doing field work with a group of guys convicted of domestic violence. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers to that. 8 KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh wow. No, don't cheers to that. To you becoming a therapist. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. To me getting my masters. We'll start there and then we'll go to the rest of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail and Emily walk in. It's a typical bachelor pad boy house. Milk crates for furniture, mess everywhere, no art on the walls. Chris is sitting on the couch watching TV. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So my roommate Chris is probably on the couch. He's going to try and start a conversation. So no matter what- do not engage. Okay? Let's go. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi! Emily and Kumail walk by Chris avoiding eye contact. Kumail closes the bedroom door behind him. CHRIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail's bed is an inflatable air mattress. There are clothes everywhere. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to watch a movie? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Should I just, put my stuff down? Or... KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I would say it's safe. You know what, go for that area. I cleaned that earlier this year. Kumail points to a corner of his room covered in dirty clothes. 9 EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I take my shoes off or is this a shoes on bed? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's a shoes off bed. I have strict rules. Emily crawls onto the air mattress. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh wow. That's totally an inflated mattress. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Did you think it would be a flat inflatable mattress? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did think it might be an actual mattress. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well air mattresses are actual mattresses. You're being bigoted towards air based comfort items. Kumail picks up the remote and turns on the TV. Night of the Living Dead is playing. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night of The Living Dead? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I haven't ever seen that movie. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so basically the dead start rising. And the good guys, um... They eye each other flirtatiously. Laugh. Lean in and kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris hits the Siri button on his iPhone. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Text Lauren. You up girl? SIRI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to say to Warren? 10 CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, no. Fuck. Chris hits the Siri button again. SIRI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to say to- CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You up? Period. Send. SIRI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That may be beyond my abilities at the moment. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail and Emily post-coital. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are these scars? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, they're a smallpox vaccination. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought only old people had those. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm from Pakistan. We're still fighting some battles you guys have already won. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you like in high school? Were you like, super funny? Were you really smart? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was very shy. They called me chashmullee. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It roughly translates to "dweeb." I'll show you a picture. 11 Kumail flips through his phone and produces his old high school photo, shows it to her. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of you in high school? Oh my god! KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boom. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm thinking I'm killing it right now. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What inspired this hair cut? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugh Grant. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no. And you're so serious. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read in an interview with Hugh Grant, he said he doesn't smile because it makes his face look fat. So I didn't smile in pictures for many years. What were you like in high school? Were you voted... Most Sexy? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I was voted "Most Noticeable." KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's really not good. I had acne, and I was a Goth and I had this terrible perm. The kids called me Beetlejuice. I don't know why. Actually I do know why, it's because they thought I looked like Beetlejuice. I think I'm done with this subject. In fact, I think I'm gonna go home. Emily gets up, pulling the blanket with her to hide her body. Kumail holds onto it, stopping her progress. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait we haven't even had sex again yet. 12 She tugs the blanket, he lets go. She dresses behind it. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. I'm really not that kind of girl. I only have sex once on a first date. Plus a hand job. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I haven't had that yet! Emily laughs. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't get that because you made fun of me. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is happening right now? What are you doing? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm changing under this blanket. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen everything. Do you remember, we were just having sex? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you were in the throes of passion then. Listen, I had a really nice time. Thank you very much. I'm just gonna call an Uber and go home. Emily pulls out her PHONE, calls an Uber. Kumail's phone makes a noise. They exchange a look. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your driver will be ready as soon as he puts on his pants. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you available for rides while we were fucking? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I only looked a couple of times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail Ubers Emily home. Emily sits in the back. 13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. Maybe I'll run into you at the club sometime and we can grab a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not really - I know this sounds like a line - but I'm not really dating right now. I have a lot of school and work and just a lot on my plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's perfect because I'm not really dating right now either. I actually have a pretty strict two-day rule where I can't see someone more than two days in a row. So since we hung out for two days, if I were to see you again, which I won't because you're not dating, I'm not dating, I wouldn't be able to see you until Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't hung out for two days. We've hung out for about five hours. Just to like, be totally clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesterday and today. Cause it's after midnight, today is actually tomorrow. Earlier tonight was yesterday. So two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, I don't date time nerds, so that really takes you off the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That works out, because I am a hard core time nerd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I can tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm like, very strict about AM/PM stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So wait, just to establish, what did we just decide?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We decided we aren't ever going to see each other again. 14 EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. I'm glad we're on the same page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail is eating brunch with his father, AZMAT, his mother SHARMEEN, his brother, NAVEED, and his sister-in- law, FATIMA. Azmat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at these jeans, Kumi. They're from Citizens of Humanity, that's the brand's name. Touch them. They're so soft. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to touch your jeans. AZMAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're like sweatpants. You should be stylish like your father. It's not very difficult. Just observe me. NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some Daddy Style. SHARMEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumi, why don't you grow a beard? Not like Naveed's, just a small one. AZMAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe like mine, small and stylish. SHARMEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumi, I've been thinking, you know, why you don't enroll for LSAT now? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah sorry, Ma. I haven't done it yet. I like that you bring it up as though you've never brought it up before. NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the stand-up coming Bhai? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going fine. SHARMEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when are you someone to stand-up? You know who I think should stand up is Malala. She has something to say. 15

dialogues.speaker: NAVEED
dialogues.text: Ma-la-la.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does open mics and she crushes. Lot of ethnic material, which I think is a crutch, and that one story gets a lot of play, but -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be on that show Saturday Night Live!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a great idea. I should e-mail them, I don't know why I hadn't thought of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I hacked into your Cousin Rehan's Facebook account-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hacked into it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they were not accepting my friend request so I had to hack into it and I discovered he and that white woman he is living with are having a baby -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, whatever. And then I hacked into Tumblr and I discovered that they named him DavГ©. Can you imagine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave. It's probably Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Dave. Yes, Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very, very, very sad. No one is going to visit that baby. That baby, mark my words, will grow up without a family. 16 FATIMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like he's dead. Or worse. SHARMEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very sad. Kumi, go pray now so we can eat ice cream. Go! The ja-namaz is downstairs. NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up yaar. Ice cream. Kumail leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: INT. KUMAIL'S PARENTS BASEMENT- DAY
dialogues.text: Kumail sets his stop watch for five minutes. He unfolds a FOLDED UP PRAYER MAT, stands beside it, looks on his phone. Kumail's stopwatch goes off. He folds up his mat.

dialogues.speaker: INT. KUMAIL'S PARENTS DINING ROOM- MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Kumail is back. Everyone is eating ice cream. AZMAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother used to make best kulfi. Your grandmother. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think ice cream is better than kulfi. AZMAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no- DOORBELL RINGS. SHARMEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I wonder who that could be? Sharmeen goes to the door. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm guessing it's a young, single Pakistani woman who just happened to be driving by our house, which is in a cul- de-sac and I'm also guessing that the phrase "dropped in" will be said in the next ten seconds. AZMAT/NAVEED/FATIMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten. Nine. Eight. Seven - 17 Sharmeen enters with a dressed up, pretty Pakistani girl ZUBEIDA, 20's. SHARMEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone. This is Zubeida. She just dropped in. ZUBEIDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salaam. ALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wa alaikum salaam. SHARMEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, sit. Zubeida sits next to Kumail and hands him a HEADSHOT. ZUBEIDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, Kumail. For your files. Your X- Files. Because that's your favorite show, huh? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much. ZUBEIDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth is out there! Nervous laughter all around. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's from the show. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharmeen and Kumail are seeing Zubeida out. SHARMEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you come back. Zubeida exits, Sharmeen looks at Kumail expectantly. SHARMEEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumi, there's not going to be a magic spark, okay? You have to work at it. You have to stay open. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Ma, yeah. I just wish you were better at it, you know? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 18 KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean you've had so much practice and you're still not that good at it! SHARMEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha. Ha. Ha. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You brought your A-game with Naveed, but then with me, you're kind of just phoning it in a little bit. SHARMEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again with the comedy, the comedy. All the time with the comedy. Be serious! KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am serious! That's why I want to help you get better!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail puts the HEADSHOT in the cigar box with a bunch of other pictures of Pakistani women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail drives Emily. She is in the back seat again. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, are you ever going to let me sit in the front seat? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm a professional. And you're paying for this ride. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to pay for this ride! It's surging right now. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sorry. You shouldn't have typed in the number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily and Kumail on the couch in front of the TV. 19 KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. The year is 1969. MGM has had a string of failures. So, it turns to its most bankable star, Vincent Price. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this your compatibility test? Like, the way people are with Vonnegut or The Big Lebowski? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Just watch the movie. And take it seriously. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to love it. I love it when men test me on my taste. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to share this movie with you, so I don't know why you're reading into- EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many women have you shown this movie to? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zero. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many women have you shown a B Horror movie to on like, a third date. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not a B horror movie. Emily laughs. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you ready? Just close your eyes cause when the menu comes up, there's some spoilers in the menu. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready, I'm ready! KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, I'll hit play. LATER, Kumail checks out Emily's reaction, she doesn't seem into it. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch! 20 EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm watching! KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhhhh! Watch this part. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop watching me! Emily yawns. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Are you tired? We can watch it later. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just have that weird yawning thing that happens, when you're watching a really boring film. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not boring! Wait for it to kick in. The plot kicks in really soon. LATER, Kumail and Emily make out. In the background, Vincent Price exacts his revenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail walks Emily to her front door. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was fun. Thanks for the ride home, but we gotta stop doing this. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I've said that before, but I really do mean it. I can't be doing this right now. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Totally. One hundred percent. I agree with you. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So don't call me again. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't. I promise. 21 EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck on all your future endeavors. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, thank you. Hey, can we have an awkward hug before we part forever? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. Kumail goes in for an awkward hug. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye. Emily goes inside. Kumail calls her immediately. She answers and they talk to each other through the door. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just promised never to call me again. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really cold out here. It's so cold. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make a pretty good point. She opens the door, Kumail goes in. EMILY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a lot warmer in here. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is warmer in here. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, it's really nice upstairs. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it? 22

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - EMILY'S APARTMENT - Emily is reading the DSM-V on the couch with her legs draped over Kumail while he listens to his stand-up set, taking notes. Emily plays footsie with Kumail. They both laugh. -- KUMAIL'S PARENTS HOUSE. Kumail's family is eating dinner. The doorbell rings and Sharmeen stands up to get the door. -- KUMAIL'S APARTMENT - Kumail puts another HEADSHOT in the cigar box along with the other pictures of Pakistani women. -- KUMAIL'S PARENTS HOUSE. Kumail's family is having dinner. The doorbell rings again. -- KUMAIL'S APARTMENT. Another HEADSHOT goes into the cigar box. --   KUMAIL'S APARTMENT. Kumail and Emily snuggle in bed. -- EMILY'S APARTMENT. Emily and Kumail play footsie on her couch. -- KUMAIL'S PARENTS HOUSE. Kumail is mid-sip of water when he hears the doorbell ring. -- KUMAIL'S APARTMENT. Another headshot into the cigar box. END MONTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily with Kumail and his friends: CJ and Mary. CJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, has Kumail told you that in addition to being an Uber driver he also has a one-man show? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he did not tell me that.   Do you really? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really nothing. It's just something I'm fiddling around with. 23

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is a one man show different from stand-up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's lots of wigs and costume changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a lot of acting in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then like at the end of it, you've got this very awkward conversation where you go, "I really liked it."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I thought you really liked it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really liked it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait to see the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will never see the show...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to see the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will love the acting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're fucking with you.   It's not really like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they fucking with me or you? It seems like they're fucking with you. 24

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiny theater, sparsely attended (Emily, her friend JESSIE, Mary and CJ). On stage is a kid's room. A NINJA TURTLES POSTER, a PRAYER MAT. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm twelve years old. This...this is home. Feels like I never left. Do you smell that? That's my mom cooking the Murgh Roghen Joash. CJ (quietly, in the audience)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear that? That's my father watching cricket on the telly. Do you feel that? That's the weight of Pakistan's history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAP OF PAKISTAN is behind Kumail. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pakistan was formed when it separated from its biggest rival, India, on August 14th 1947.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail now wears CRICKET PADS & holds a BAT. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six runs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail pulls up a diagram of a cricket field. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silly Mid On, Short Mid Wicket, Midwicket, Deep Mid Wicket, Mid On, Long On, Long Off... CJ stretches in the audience. JESSIE (quietly, from the audience)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to leave as soon as the show's over. I can't stay. 25 Emily nods in understanding. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if you get a Silly Mid On fielder, you know you're getting a Yorker soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Return to the MAP OF PAKISTAN KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So to review, Pakistan's biggest exports are cotton and... AUDIENCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concrete. CJ (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail wears a SHALWAR KURTA. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eid Mubarak. That's our Christmas. Except instead of the traditional Christmas ham, we serve Mitthai, which my khansama Chris will serve to you right now. Khansama is Urdu for servant. Chris hands out WHITE SUGARY CHALKY CUBES from a tray. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'd like to make it at home, the main ingredients are condensed milk, sugar, and love. At least, that was my mom's recipe. CJ (quietly, to Chris)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you look like a children's toy from Malaysia. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now all rise for the Pakistani national anthem. All stand with their hand over their hearts as Kumail sings. 26

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily meets Kumail backstage.        She wears a SWEATSHI with BRAINS on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!    So? What did you think? EMILY Um, I thought it was great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? EMILY I never knew that Pakistan had the world's largest irrigation system. KUMAIL Yeah. Something like 14 million hectares are being irrigated. As soon as I read that I was like "oh, that's going in the show."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CJ and Mary appear behind them. CJ Hey, that was... You were in the zone, man. That was the best one we've seen. MARY Yeah, that was so honest and good. CJ And you know what I realized halfway through? You're from Pakistan! Good to see you Emily!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye guys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep up the-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit. KUMAIL They seem to like it. EMILY They're so nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 27 KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, really what did you think?   You know, it's a work in progress... EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really liked it. I learned a lot. About Pakistan, and cricket. All those positions. But I just wish that I learned more about you. Does that make any sense? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail is asleep. EMILY is awake. She looks over at Kumail, and very silently, guiltily, crawls out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily sneaks past Chris who is passed out on the couch and goes into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily looks around Kumail's bedroom for something. She starts putting her clothes on. Kumail wakes up. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi! KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 3 AM. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that diner around the corner open? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 24 hours. Why?   You want an old lemon meringue pie? 28

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so funny! Actually, no, I just...I really need to get a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can make you coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love diner coffee.     That burnt taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I'll come with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no! Why would you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bad neighborhood. I'm not gonna let you go on your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why cause I'm a woman? Seriously, that's the most misogynist thing I've ever heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you being so weird?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, I'm not being weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're being so weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. You're being weird!    You're being so weird!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How am I weird? I want to sleep while it's sleep time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is normal. Girls go to get coffee in the middle of the night. Have you never had a girlfriend before? This is what it's like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? 29 EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is not okay. Everything is not okay. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can tell me anything, you know that right? You can tell me anything. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to take a shit, okay? I have to take a huge fucking dookie. I can't take a poo in your bathroom because you don't have any matches and you don't have any air freshener. What kind of person doesn't have any matches or air freshener in the bathroom? The walls are so thin! And Chris is right out there. Kumail starts laughing. EMILY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please stop laughing! Please, please. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I have an idea.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. KUMAIL'S HOUSE- MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Kumail sits on the stoop outside. After a beat, Emily sheepishly walks out and sits next to him. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not want to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naveed fully geared up: batting helmet, gloves, elbow pad, eye-black. Kumail behind the backstop, watching. NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch and learn, Bhai. It's all about shifting weight and torque. A BALL ZINGS at Naveed, he misses completely. 30 NAVEED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Christ! KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Another ball zings. Misses again. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're like a Pakistani Sammy Sosa. An 8-year old KID in a cage nearby cracks a clean hit. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey he's pretty good. Just do what he's doing. Naveed throws down his bat and exits the cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail and Naveed eat from tiffins & ramekins. They f fight over their meal. NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine, mine. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These cookies are really good. NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're biscuits! Listen to yourself. You hardly sound Pakistani. "Cookies"? You sound like Julia Louis-Dreyfus. You're such a burger. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a burger. NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you are. You're a big fat burger. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a burger and biscuit is actually a British term. 31 NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well thank you for that information that no one gives a shit about and you should listen to mom and grow a beard. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gets really itchy, I've tried. It's all patchy. NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try being a man and conditioning like I do. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the whole thing with Muslims growing beards anyway? It's such an arbitrary thing. Like who decided that? Oh, we have to have beards. NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. There are a billion of us and you are the only one with the truth. Is that right? The sun is just shining down on you right now. It's just parting like "ahh". KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I have to tell you something, Bhai. NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go. Yeah? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been dating this girl. NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acha. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's white. NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were going to say you were involved in a hit and run or you got caught forging some checks. But a WHITE GIRL? Such a cliche. A white family stares in their direction. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay! We hate terrorists! 32 NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. I understand. You're in America. You wanna mow a few lawns and see what it's like. But eventually you have to marry a Pakistani girl. Like I hung out with other girls. But then I married Fatima. We hardly spoke two words to each other the first few months! But now, Kumi, she's like my best friend. You have to break up with her immediately. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I find someone who's as good for me as Fatima is for you, Mom would understand, right? I mean, she wouldn't love me less? NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She would definitely love you less. Slowly, you'd sort of -- what's the word when guys stop returning girls' calls? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ghosting? NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (dead serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to end it now or Mom will fucking ghost you. Naveed gets up. NAVEED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now come on. He exits, leaving Kumail alone at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail and Emily are sipping wine out of plastic cups. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting a lot of bright fruit. I'd say it's very fruit forward. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. It tastes like grape juice that's gone bad. How do you know so much about wine? 33

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, because, I was pretty unhappy in my first marriage and I drank a lot and one way to cover drinking is to know a lot about wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry wait, what did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That knowing a lot about wine sort of covers for drinking a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the huge piece of information you're trying to blow right past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I was married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was. I was married. Do you want to talk about something else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, cause I don't really have any questions other than...when did you get married? When did you get divorced? What's his name? How tall is he? Did you love him? I guess I have a couple of questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. His name was, is Ryan. We met in college. Everyone I knew was getting married super young, so we did. And one day I was at a restaurant and I saw this couple making out and I thought "I don't think about my husband like that, but I guess that's okay" and then another part of my brain was like "NO

dialogues.speaker: IT'S NOT OKAY THIS IS YOUR LIFE". I
dialogues.text: feel like this is freaking you out. Does this freak you out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not freaking me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna put pressure on you. And I know it's only been a few months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 34 EMILY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I just wanted to tell you that I am completely overwhelmed by you. It's the last thing I was expecting. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is also the last thing I was expecting and I also feel completely overwhelmed by you. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a weird thing to say. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? I just said what you said. Exactly what you said. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it wasn't weird when I said it.   It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily watches Kumail sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail and Emily grocery shop. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So listen, my parents are coming to town this weekend. Maybe you wanna come for lunch? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, we can't because of the two-day rule, right? You'll come to Mary's party Friday night and then you'll probably spend the night. So I won't be able to see you until Monday, so... EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Well, I would love to meet your parents. They live in the city, right? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they live in the suburbs. You know, I don't really see them very much. 35 EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have they asked about me? What do they think? Do they want to meet me? My parents want to meet you. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, of course. They're dying to meet you. Emily stumbles. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow... oh my god.. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? What happened? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally fine. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need assistance? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I just tweaked my ankle. I took this stupid hip hop dance class last weekend. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should get it looked at. Do you want ice? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm walking on it. I'm totally fine. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you a bag of ice? I can carry you? I can carry you the rest of the day? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail, seriously, stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily is eating cereal in bed. Kumail is in the kitchen making coffee. KUMAIL (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I liked your friends.     That Craig guy or was it Greg? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36 KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can never tell with those names. I'm glad I like him cause I don't want to have to come up with excuses to avoid him, you know. Like, oh no, I have kite surfing tonight. Emily opens the cigar box and sees the headshots of the women. She flips through them. KUMAIL (O.S.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know in the UK it's pronounced "Crayg". Which is good because that's actually how it's written, right? He's a "Crate" guy. Kumail enters. KUMAIL (CONT'D) (sees her with the box)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to tell you about that. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you like judging Pakistan's Next Top Model or something? Seriously, who are these women? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how we have arranged marriage in my culture? These are those women. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are women in Pakistan who want to marry you? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not in Pakistan. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've met these women? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just with my parents. We haven't like - EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not serious about this, are you? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my mom's thing, I just go along with it. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what does your mom think about you and me, then? 37 Beat. EMILY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't know about me, does she? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Emily storms out of the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking five months   of red flags. Oh my god, I'm so stupid.   You ducking my parents. Oh my god,   the two day rule! Seriously, red flag   after red flag. Such a liar! Emily storms back into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMILY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lie to me. You lie to your parents. And those are just the people you like! Is there someone that you're not lying to? I'd love to meet them, cause then I could tell them what a fucking liar you are! KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't tell me about your being divorced until recently. You were hiding fucking something too! EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My divorce does not mean our future is impossible. It actually means the direct opposite. I'm not hiding anything from you. Okay? I'm an open fucking book. You wanna know what's in my cigar box? Stickers. Stickers and stamps. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you a therapist? Aren't you supposed to be good at handling these types of things. 38 EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are my fucking shoes? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you supposed to be handling this better than you are right now? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm expressing myself! Emily storms back out of the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs her shoes. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what we call "arranged marriage" in my culture, Emily? Marriage! Okay? We just call it marriage. There's another type of marriage that's called "love marriage" and that's bad. My cousin Rehan married an Irish woman and he was kicked out of the family! And nobody is allowed to talk to him. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me any of this? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I didn't think you'd fucking understand and I was fucking right! EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think I could fathom your life in any fucking way? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fighting a fourteen hundred year old culture! You were ugly in high school! There's a big fucking difference! (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I can't lose my family. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you imagine a world where we end up together? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. 39 EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go. Don't fucking call me. Emily leaves.

dialogues.speaker: INT. KUMAIL'S PARENTS HOUSE- LATER
dialogues.text: Kumail has family dinner with another Pakistani girl. YAZMIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Multi-grain, pumpernickel, pita bread, hot dog buns, croutons..I can't eat any of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is on stage. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want kids. People say, Sam, you're gonna love it. You're gonna have a kid and he's gonna be your best friend. A best friend that pukes on you and shits everywhere, and is constantly screaming. I already have friends like that. People say, Sam... Kumail sits with CJ backstage. CJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're bummed. Look, Emily's a good person, I'm not saying she's not. All I'm saying is this is the universe telling you: seize your moment. Be a little selfish and pursue your career. Bob Dalavan's gonna be here on Thursday. If you book the Montreal Comedy Festival, it would change things for you. You don't wanna get stuck in Chicago, right? You don't wanna be like Sam Highsmith. He's been doing the "people say Sam" bit since '03. They look at Sam on stage. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People say, Sam... CJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you want? 40 KUMAIL It's amazing. It's the same material. SAM What do people say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam! SAM People say what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam! SAM I'm Sam Highsmith. Thank you very much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam exits the stage. KUMAIL I'm gonna tell him. I'm gonna tell him how I actually feel about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam passes. KUMAIL (CONT'D) Great set, dude!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CJ fistbumps Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crushing it! KUMAIL Love the new stuff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam exits. KUMAIL (CONT'D) We should be ashamed of ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're weak.

dialogues.speaker: INT. KUMAIL'S PARENTS HOUSE- NIGHT
dialogues.text: The family is in the living room with, KHADIJA, another Pakistani girl. 41 KHADIJA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't really call it an obsession but... I'm pretty good at magic. SHARMEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you make his belly disappear? AZMAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm too happy with my belly. KHADIJA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does anyone have a dollar? AZMAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will give you something. Azmat hands her a bill. KHADIJA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20? Big spender. Andrew Jackson? Don't you think he'd look cool with sunglasses? She draws a pair of sunglasses on top of Andrew Jackson's head, and folds the bill. KHADIJA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sprinkle the magic dust on. Khadija makes a sprinkling motion with her fingers over the folded up bill. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you can't do it without the magic dust. KHADIJA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I need it. All right... She snaps her fingers. KHADIJA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. Watching carefully - Khadija unfolds the bill. Andrew Jackson is now wearing the sunglasses. FATIMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is amazing! And he does look better with glasses! KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you do that? 42 KHADIJA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, a magician never reveals her tricks. Here's your twenty back, Mr. Nanjiani. AZMAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I could use this twenty dollar bill to buy something? KHADIJA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks better now, right? Kumail shares a look with Sharmeen. INT. KUMAIL'S APARTMENT - NIGHT INT. Kumail puts Khadija's headshot in the cigar box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail does stand-up. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was watching this monster movie with my friend and he turned to me and was like, "what would you do in that situation?" I'm never going to be one of the last guys alive. I'm going to be the first guy to die. I die so the other characters get to find out something weird is going on. I go off alone to find the cat. Kumail sees Bob Dalavan at a table with CJ. Dalavan listens to Kumail's set and seems into it. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never even find out that there were monsters. To me, the plot of the movie was "we're at a research facility and the cat's missing." The end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail talks to a DENISE, writes her name on a napkin in URDU. Chris and Mary are nearby. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise. This is your name in Urdu. 43 DENISE Wow, that is so cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob Dalavan approaches. BOB DALAVAN Kumail? Hey, Bob Dalavan. KUMAIL Yeah, I know you. BOB DALAVAN You had some very interesting premises in your set tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. BOB DALAVAN I just wanted you to know that you made the finals for the Montreal Showcase. KUMAIL Oh my god. Thank you. BOB DALAVAN You too, Mary. Congrats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, ok! BOB DALAVAN So we'll see you guys up there. We'll be in touch. CHRIS What about C-Dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that? CHRIS Um, me. What about me? DALAVAN You know, funny stuff, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob exits. DENISE (to Kumail) Do you wanna go somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 44 KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, let's go somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail asleep in his bed, DENISE is asleep next to him. C.U. CELLPHONE ringing. "UNKNOWN CALLER" blinks on the screen. KUMAIL stirs awake. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? JESSIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail. It's Jessie. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.     Who? JESSIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessie. I'm in school with Emily. Listen, Emily is in the hospital. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Kumail jolts out of bed. JESSIE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you just go, please? She needs someone there. We have exams tomorrow so nobody else can go. Kumail fumbles to get dressed, as we CUT TO...

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. KUMAIL'S CAR
dialogues.text: Kumail drives in the middle of the night, empty streets. JESSIE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's still in the ER. Could you just go and sit with her? I was there for as long as I could, but it's a crazy time for all of us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MASSIVE HOSPITAL looms over a quiet residential area. 45

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail walks up to the reception desk. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I am looking for Emily Gardner. Um, Emily Gardner? She was checked in... A MAN is rolled in a stretcher by EMTs.   The nurses run off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail walks by curtained beds hearing screams, wailing, moaning. He finally sees Emily in a bed, hooked up to wires and monitors. She looks scared, a bit sedated. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessie called me and wanted me to make sure you were okay. So how are you doing? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Totally fine. Never been better. A thousand percent fine. Just like fainted a little at work. I didn't have breakfast this morning. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breakfast is the most important meal of the day. You know that. NURSE BETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Gardner. Your room will be ready soon. Okay? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, actually I'd love to go home and sleep in my own bed. NURSE BETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, can you step outside a moment, please? If you want to stay you have to go to the security desk to get a pass. 46 KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the security desk? NURSE BETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's downstairs. Exactly where you walked in. At the security desk. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security desk is at the security desk. Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily is propped up. Kumail next to her. He has a badge. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you something? Water. Juice. Coffee? Emily is essentially passed out. Kumail isn't sure what to do. NURSE JUDY brings in a doctor. DR. WRIGHT, 30s, looks over at Kumail. DR. WRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I speak with you for a second? KUMAIL (to Emily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail follows Dr. Wright out to a busy hallway. DR. WRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a massive infection in her lungs. All her vitals are elevated. Does she have HIV? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No. I mean she-- DR. WRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you her husband? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-- 47 DR. WRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to intubate her immediately. I need a family member to sign this. So I'm going to ask you again. Are you her husband? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does "intubate" mean? DR. WRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to put her on a respirator and to do that we need to put her in a medically induced coma. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coma. DR. WRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, to stabilize her so we can work on the infection. And it needs to happen right now. So, I'm going to ask you one last time, are you her husband? Kumail signs the forms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Wright and Orderlies rush Emily down the hallway on a GURNEY. Kumail runs with them. Trying to keep up. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?! Where are you taking me? Emily disappears into an OR. Kumail watches DOCTORS and NURSES descend on her. Nurse Judy puts her hand on his arm. NURSE JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should call her family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail, freaked out, stares at Emily, hooked up to various wires on her arms and chest. He sees her purse and digs out her iPhone. It's locked. He looks over at Emily. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. 48 He puts her finger on the phone. It unlocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail scrolls down to PARENTS on Emily's phone and dials. A WOMAN'S VOICE picks up, "Hello?"... KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mrs. Gardner? This is Kumail, Emily's friend. I'm so sorry to be calling you so late. Emily's fine. Just want to get that taken care of. She's fine. She is at City View Hospital in Chicago in a medically induced coma. But the doctors say that- - Yes I did say coma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail sits in a chair looking at Emily who is hooked up to a breathing machine. He dozes off.

dialogues.speaker: INT. EMILY'S ICU ROOM- NEXT MORNING
dialogues.text: Kumail sleeps. He wakes up to a COUPLE sitting by Emily's bed. TERRY, 50's, rumpled, BETH, 50's, put- together. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I'm Kumail. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know who you are Kumail. They're clearly tired, terrified. Nurse Judy enters. NURSE JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. Gardner. The doctors would like to see you now. BETH (whispers, to Emily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be right back. They leave. Kumail awkwardly follows them. 49

dialogues.speaker: INT. BEREAVEMENT ROOM- MOMENTS LATER, (SUNDAY MORNING)
dialogues.text: Kumail, Terry, Beth sit. A waterfall coos. Meditations on the wall: "Darkest Nights Produce The Brightest Stars"; "Grief is love's unwillingness to let go", etc. NURSE JUDY Listen, the doctor will be here any minute. She's just running a little late. Don't read anything into this being in the bereavement room. It was the only room we had available. TERRY Okay. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exits.    Terry nervously taps on his knees, annoying Beth. BETH Terry, Terry-- it's driving me insane. TERRY I know, I know. But it makes me feel better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor walks in. DR. CUNNINGHAM Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth and Terry stand to greet her. DR. CUNNINGHAM (CONT'D) Please sit. I'm Dr. Cunningham, Emily's attending. I'll be coordinating all the doctors and orchestrating her treatment strategy. BETH "All the doctors"? How many are there? DR. CUNNINGHAM Five. BETH Five? Why so many? Is that normal? Dr. CUNNINGHAM Yes, it's standard with patients in the ICU. We come at it from different angles--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50 When we cut back it is a different person now. DR. LEWIN. Terry, Kumail and Beth stay but the doctors change. DR. LEWIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We immediately initiated orotracheal intubation. Thankfully it hasn't affected her heart at this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. WHELAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know the exact nature of the infection yet, but we've got her on a broad spectrum of antibiotics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. PLATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...critical infections centering around the costodiaphragmatic--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. SPELLMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our theory is methicillin-resistant staphylococcus aureus. TERRY (taking NOTES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. Is staphylococcus with an "f" or a "ph"? DR. SPELLMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ph. MONTAGE of doctors babbling unintelligibly as Beth and Terry visibly panic.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WAITING ROOM- MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Terry, Beth, and Kumail sit, surrounded by: KIDS WITH COLORING BOOKS, ADULTS WITH MAGAZINES, various CHARGERS plugged into the wall. These are the PEOPLE WHO WAIT. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was very reassuring, wasn't it? Apparently, there are good and bad comas. And the kind that they put her in, the medically induced ones, are definitely the good kind of coma. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 51 KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you know how there are good and bad carbs. Gremlins, those can be good or bad. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Kumail... We're gonna handle things from here. You've been very helpful. Thank you. For signing the thing- KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pleasure TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can go now. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... okay... all right. Peace in the Mideast. He picks up his backpack and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail, Mary, Chris, CJ, & Sam sit with notebooks ope CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about this? I saw a sniffer dog at the airport get a boner. Does that mean drugs or bombs? CJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. What if instead of it being at the airport, you quit comedy and never did comedy ever again? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. It's a good bit. CJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for the sake of the public. So they wouldn't have to look at your face or hear your words. Kumail interjects. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay that I'm not there, right? Like, I don't need to be there, right? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? 52 CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He put his girlfriend in a coma. You know, the way you do. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He signed a paper that allowed doctors to put her-- CJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He suggested it. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gonna be fine. She's gonna be fine. They said she's gonna be fine. Doctors know medical stuff. That's what doctors do. They're good at medical stuff. This is a medically induced coma. This is their specialty. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might be a good thing. She might wake up with a new skill. Like my cousin blacked out once and when he came to, he thought he knew a different language. CJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it was just gibberish that he made up. It was brain damage. CJ and Mary shake their heads. Kumail looks freaked out. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got another Taco Bell one...

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOSPITAL WAITING ROOM- MONDAY MORNING
dialogues.text: Terry and Beth wait. Beth is sewing a shirt of Emily's. Terry is pacing. Kumail walks up to them. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you forget something? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she up yet? 53 TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she's not. They won't tell us anything. We've been here all morning. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you guys said you don't need me to stay, but I think I'm just going to wait anyway. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys broke up. I'm not sure why you're here. You don't have to worry about being committed to anything, Kumail. You didn't want to when she was awake. There's no need to do it when she's unconscious. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more complicated than that-- BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it? Because I know about the two-day rule, I know about the headshots and the secrets. She tells us everything. (beat, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really don't have to stay Kumail. You have already done a lot. Kumail is speechless. After a beat of awkward quiet-- KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just gonna stay for a second. Is this seat- ? Kumail gestures to the empty seat next to Beth, but she throws her sewing on it and turns away. Kumail walks to another row of seats and sits down, facing Emily's parents. Beth watches him intensely for a few beats before Kumail turns to the woman sitting next to him. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that lady still looking at me?

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOSPITAL CAFETERIA- LATER
dialogues.text: Kumail carries his tray, spots Terry and Beth together having a hushed conversation. He sits at a different table. Terry waves at him. Kumail heads over to them. 54 TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reason you should eat there by yourself. Right, hon? BETH (barely looks up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a free country. Kumail nods. Sits down. They eat. It's awkward. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your sandwich? BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best fuckin' sandwich I've ever had. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine's good. Tuna's always a gamble. You know, we're not by the water. Well, we are by the water, but it's a lake. There's no tuna in the lake. Whatever. I threw the dice. I got the 7's, I guess. Whatever the good dice number is. More silence. TERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, uh, 9/11? Blank looks from Kumail and Beth. TERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean, I've always wanted to have a conversation about it with...people. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never talked to people about 9/11? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, uh, what's your stance? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's my stance on 9/11? Oh, ummmm... Anti. It was a tragedy. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean we lost 19 of our best guys. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? 55 KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a joke, obviously. 9/11 was a terrible tragedy, and it's not funny to joke about it. Beth and Terry are PAGED on the intercom. They quickly gather up their things and get up to leave. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, can I come?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY BETH
dialogues.text: Yeah.                         No. Terry gestures for Kumail to get up and follow them. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DOCTOR'S OFFICE- MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Kumail, Beth, Terry, and Dr. Cunningham. DR. CUNNINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this isn't the news you were hoping for but we aren't ready to bring Emily out of the coma yet. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I- TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? DR. CUNNINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The antibiotics aren't doing exactly what we'd hoped they would, and we don't want to mess around. So we're going to perform surgery tomorrow morning to remove the infection. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second- Dr. Spellman told us that the antibiotics would work. He didn't say anything at all about surgery. 56 TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean? What kind of surgery? DR. CUNNINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called thoracentesis, it's a very common procedure. We're going to go in between the ribs and remove the infection. TERRY (scribbling in his notebook)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you spell that please? Thora- ? What's the last part? DR. CUNNINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Centesis. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where is the infection? DR. CUNNINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the lung. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the risk? DR. CUNNINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Low. My advice to you is that you go home, you get something to eat, and try to relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail drives Beth and Terry. Everyone looks dazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail helps Beth and Terry carry their luggage upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter. Beth and Terry begin looking around. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She left the lights on, eh? 57 BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My favorite sweater. Terry looks at Emily's bookshelf and pulls out a BOOK. Beth puts the sweater on and takes her laptop out, sits on the couch. BETH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna do some research. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hey, that's the book I gave her. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I gave her that one. Hey, do you have that little notebook from the doctors? Terry hands her the notebook. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this is the book I gave her. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just gonna clean up Emily's rooms real quick. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember. I met her at the falafel place and then we went to that book store that's hardly ever open and I bought it for her. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not the only one who gives her things. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up with you? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just tired of you thinking that you're the only one who gives her things. I gave her that book. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the inscription. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's stupid. Beth shrugs and goes back to the computer. Terry looks at the inscription, frowns, puts it back. 58

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail leaves the door open a crack. He sees in the LIVING ROOM Terry and Beth are whisper-quarrelling. He begins to clean. Pulls a MARIJUANA PIPE and BAG OF WEED off the dresser and shoves it into the back of her closet. He notices the BRAINS SHIRT in the closet. He touches it. We see a flashback of Emily wearing the sweatshirt. He opens a cigar box on her dresser and pulls out POLAROID pictures. They're of him and Emily. More flashbacks of Emily. TERRY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail. Kumail, a bit startled, turns. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... Didn't mean to surprise you. I was just wondering if we wanna do anything. Got any parlor games... KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't-what are parlor games? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Card games, word games. You play any word games? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I've never played- TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever played You Can't Rhyme It? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does that go? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's basically where you try to find a word, a real word, that nobody can rhyme. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, Stonehenge. 59 TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, see you would win. That'd be a winner. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't play board games. I play video games. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the thing. Everybody now needs Nintendo, the game thing, electronics, a thousand dollars. When I was a kid, a piece of chalk and a pavement, that's your entertainment. Hopscotch, tic tac toe, throw the chalk at Jimmy. There you go, three games right there. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy was a real guy? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well there was no particular Jimmy, whoever got hit with the chalk, he was the Jimmy. Kumail gets a call from Naveed on his phone. He ignores it. TERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just trying to figure out what to do. Kumail and Terry walk into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail and Terry walk back in. Beth is on her laptop. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, tonight's no good for me. I'd love to, but I'm actually gigging tonight, which is like an industry word we use for when we do shows. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, there's a big Montreal Comedy festival audition coming up, and I'm actually headlining tonight. 60

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
