dialogues.text: Oh. That's cool. I haven't been to comedy show since the 80's - Rita Rudner at Caroline's. Remember that, hon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ. Pleural effusion and empyema, --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) Maybe we should go to Kumail's show. What do you think? Wouldn't that be fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god. These pictures are horrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay listen, why don't we go to the comedy club with him? It'll take our mind off of things right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to get my mind off it, Terry. Our daughter's having surgery tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I need the distraction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then why don't you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I want you to come with me. I don't wanna be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. But I'm bringing my iPad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah it's sold out. I should've said it before you guys had the whole discussion. It sold out super quickly. They were shocked at how quickly it sold out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can get us in? You're the headliner, right? That's what you said. I mean, if you're the headliner, you can get two more in, right? 61 Kumail looks pained. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a good point. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll sit in the back. They got food there? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've got waffle fries and um- Kumail turns and begins to head out the door. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hospital had waffle fries too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail's family sits with a young Pakistani woman SUMERA. There's an empty chair where KUMAIL usually sits. SUMERA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've actually never been to   Pakistan. My parents moved here for grad   school and they just stayed here. I've   never even been to Canada. So uh, when   is Kumail coming? SHARMEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming. Right, Naveed? Traffic? NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard everything's bumper-to-bumper on the Dan Ryan Expressway. SUMERA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's weird because I took the Dan Ryan Expressway here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is on stage performing. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your dad's sister's favorite kind of music to dance to? Kumail and Mary chat off to the side of the stage. 62 KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily's parents are here. CHRIS (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Auntz, auntz, auntz. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight? Why? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anybody here from out of town? Terry claps. Beth barely pays attention. Chris focuses on Terry. CHRIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few, a few. What's your name, sir? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry. And who's this lady next to you? Is it Cloth? A little Terry Cloth? BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Beth. Backstage Kumail peers through the curtain, cringing. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth. Pretty close. Terry-Beth, where are you guys from? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're from North Carolina. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh North Carolina. The Tar Heel State! Home of Krispy Kreme donuts! And what brings you to Chicago? BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our daughter's in a coma. Chris tries to absorb that. He turns to another person in the crowd. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you from? 63

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUMERA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting late, I should go. She moves to get up, but Sharmeen and Azmat stop her. AZMAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think I should call him up, I'll just call him up. (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Kumi-beta? What do you mean, who is calling? This is your father. Ok, ok. (he hangs up the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will be here any moment. (to Naveed in Urdu)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just faked that call. Did you call him? NAVEED (in Urdu)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred times. No response. SUMERA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I should make something clear. (in Urdu)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can understand what you're saying. FATIMA (in Urdu)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said you'd never been to Pakistan. SUMERA (in Urdu)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I'd never been there but we speak it at home. AZMAT (in Urdu)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For someone who's never been to Pakistan you speak Urdu very well. SUMERA (in Urdu)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. AZMAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to sing? Azmat leads the group in song while Sumera reluctantly claps alongside them. 64

dialogues.speaker: INT. TRIPLE DOOR- LATER
dialogues.text: Kumail on stage performing. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to name my kid Void so he won't be able to cash any of his paychecks. Beth and Terry watch from the audience, laughing. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir, this says Void on it. But that's my name. Curse you, father! (gesturing upwards)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I work on the second floor of the bank in this fantasy scenario. HECKLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to ISIS! A hush over the crowd. Kumail not sure how to respond. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toast is a really strange food. BETH (to heckler)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you just say? HECKLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, he should go back to ISIS. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toast is the only food that- BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's a really confusing position. Do you want ISIS to have more people? HECKLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I was saying that to him because... BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess what everybody? We've got an ISIS recruiter here. The crowd laughs. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad we got to the bottom of that. Toast is like a- 65 BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it about him that made you say that? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we know what the answer is. HECKLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady I wasn't talking to you. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it about him? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have to go down this path. We know what's at the end of it. HECKLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuz of how he looks. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is like saying that all frat boys wearing country club hats and Hawaiian shirts have shriveled up, tiny little dicks! The crowd reacts. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, Beth, this is a bad way for you to find out, but he's right. I actually am a terrorist. I just do stand-up comedy on the side to keep a low profile. HECKLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First of all, very clever. Did you write that at home? Toast is- BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! HECKLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fuck you! 66 HECKLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a bitch, you know that? Beth jumps out of her seat and rushes towards the Heckler. A man restrains her while she claws at him. BETH (being dragged out by security)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna fucking kill you! What's your fucking phone number?! Terry heads out after Beth. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry everybody. I'm sorry. He stops in front of the Heckler. TERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sorry actually cause you're a terrible person... I don't want to kick your ass here in front of everybody. Yeah, that's right. I've got levels, motherfucker. This elevator goes all the way fucking down, you fucking prick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail drives with Beth in the passenger seat and Terry in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, Terry, and Kumail enter, all a bit shell-shocked. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll make tea. (reconsiders)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually I'll open a bottle of wine. (re-reconsiders)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Emily have whiskey? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On top of the fridge. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So uh, Cubs doing good, huh? 67 KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know anything about baseball. She starts to pour. They all just sit there. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so sorry about that. That was... I just sort of lost control. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was sexy. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. Not like sexy, but like cool sexy. Not like aroused sexy. I'm gonna not say sexy anymore. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you guys wanna get something to eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail, Terry and Beth are eating pizza. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is it always like that? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh like tonight? No, usually a different mom comes in to help me. I'm joking. No, it's not always like that. I'd quit if it was. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a joke. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Terry, don't. Terry's about as funny as a fart at a funeral. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is funny, this is a funny one. A giraffe walks into a bar and he says to the bartender, "Highballs on me." You get it, right? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that was the end of the joke? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. 68 KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the whole joke? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the joke. That's the beauty of it, boom. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought there was more. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a giraffe, he's tall, so it would stand to reason his testicles are high and a highball is a type of drink, and you ruined it by saying I wasn't funny first. He gives up and eats. Kumail chuckles. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's good. I like my jokes thoroughly explained. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just busting my high balls. Kumail laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry swills WINE and swishes some in his mouth. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Complex finish. Flamboyant mouth-feel. Good. How about you? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm, fruit-forward. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good term. Absolutely fruit-forward. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one is in the front seat. It's driving the wine car. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like wine cause of the buzz. 69 TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a bit of a lightweight. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is Terry! He'll be passed out on the sofa in less than an hour! TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah that's nonsense. You know that's not true.

dialogues.speaker: INT. EMILY'S LIVING ROOM- LATER
dialogues.text: Terry, passed out on the sofa snoring. Kumail & Beth sit. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't supposed to be on the show tonight, were you? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? Me on the show tonight? Yeah, yeah I was. I was the headliner. Beth stares him down. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I lied about the show to get out of hanging out with you guys. And then I lied about headlining to impress you guys. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that didn't work. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also, I think I screwed up with your daughter. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you did. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how people do it when their family's sick. My Uncle Lew, he got cancer, then he had a stroke, then a heart attack, then he had a recurrence of the cancer. But you know what killed him? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cancer? 70 BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Car accident. We think maybe it was a heart attack while he was driving. And he did still have cancer too. And you know what? He ate sprouts his whole fucking life. Hadn't had a yolk in 30 years. I don't know how I'm going to sleep tonight. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna stress eat? BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck yeah.

dialogues.speaker: INT. EMILY'S KITCHEN TABLE- LATER
dialogues.text: Beth shows Kumail GOTH PHOTOS of EMILY in Emily's high school yearbook and on her laptop, amidst take out containers, desserts, chicken strips, whipped cream. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most noticeable. Oh no, hold on, there's more. Beth scrolls through photos of Emily in GOTH ATTIRE, SWORDS, BLACK ROSES. She comes to photos of Emily in a cemetery. BETH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The legendary cemetery photo shoot. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I laughed so hard when I saw these. She got so mad at me. Kumail laughs. Terry stirs. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna wake him up. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? He can sleep through anything. Hey Terry! She claps and Terry shifts, but doesn't wake up. 71 KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you and Terry meet? BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to East Carolina University and I was waiting tables. We met at this coffee shop, I was waiting on him. I liked his hair. He was a teacher already. Thick New York accent like nobody I'd ever met. Totally wrong for me. So naturally we fell-in-love. My family could not stand him. We're all military people, army pilots. All my brothers played football. Terry couldn't even change a tire. My father got so mad he broke every dinner plate we had. Now back then, you go to the gas station, you fill up your tank, you get a dinner plate. But just one at a time. Cup, saucer. It took us a year of fill-ups to get the whole set back. And Terry just stuck around. Eventually they just all got over it. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just got over it. How? BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of fucked up dinners. How'd your parents meet, Kumail? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we have arranged marriage as you know. A big group got together to see a movie, but really it was just a set up so my mom and dad could meet. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What movie did they see? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea. I never asked. They look back at the GOTH PHOTOS of Emily. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's great, you know? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel good about this surgery. 72 KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. These doctors know what they're doing. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No they don't. They're just winging it like everybody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail gets into his car and checks his phone. Seventeen missed calls from his mom and ten voicemails. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. Then he notices an old voicemail from Emily. He hits play on the message. EMILY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey it's me. So I tried making some Pakistani food to surprise you. And either I'm a bad cook or all Pakistani food is terrible. I don't know yet. Bye! He hasn't heard her voice in a while. He listens to another old voicemail. EMILY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey it's me. If you just wanna come over and like kiss me for two seconds, I'd really love that tonight. Ok. Bye! He listens to another. EMILY'S VOICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey it's me. So did you want to meet at the gallery, or - Oh my god! Oh my god, a bird just hit me in the head. Oh my god I'm not kidding. I'll call you right back. Oh my god, is it okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily lies unconscious in her hospital bed. 73

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Spellman sits with Kumail, Terry and Beth. DR. SPELLMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The infection around the lungs was removed. We should be able to pull her out soon. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How soon? DR. SPELLMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She should be up by tomorrow morning at the latest. We'll also test the pleural fluid from the thoracentesis so we can create a more targeted antibiotic strategy. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is good news? DR. SPELLMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very good news. We'll just hold onto her for a few more days and then you can have her back. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a fighter, right? DR. SPELLMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail eating with his family. SHARMEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was so worried. We saw on the news that a train derailed and we thought that you were on the train and you had died. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody died on that train, Ma. SHARMEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But did they look under the train? 74 AZMAT So, where were you last night? What were you doing? KUMAIL Nothing. I wasn't doing anything. SHARMEEN Kumail. KUMAIL Alright, I'll tell you. I was... studying for the LSAT. SHARMEEN Really? KUMAIL Yup. I signed up. And if I pass, I'm gonna go to law school, become a lawyer, and do law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorbell rings. Sharmeen gets up. SHARMEEN Oh, let me see who that could be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exits. KUMAIL Really, Dad? You said that nobody was gonna come. That it was gonna be just us. NAVEED Hey Kumi, do you know this guy? People say Sam. People say Sam. Do you know him? KUMAIL Yeah, I know. FATIMA He should be on Saturday Night Live. NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharmeen returns with Khadija. SHARMEEN Everybody remember Khadija? She just dropped in. She was just in the neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75 Khadija waves awkwardly, and her parents, FARHAN and TINA appear. SHARMEEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And these are her parents, Farhan and Tina. They also just dropped in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina holds forth in Urdu. The grown-ups laugh. Khadija tries to lock eyes with Kumail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail walks Khadija to her door. KHADIJA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've just been through so many of these appointments and I never have anything in common with the guys. You know when girls at work complain about dating, I just want to body slam them. They have no idea. I don't know. My mom says I'm becoming the bruised apple at the bottom of the apple bucket. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. You're not. KHADIJA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not. KHADIJA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do you want to hangout sometime? Like without our parents? Have you been to the cat cafe? The cats just come up to you and nestle in your lap and you just pet them. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that's a good idea. KHADIJA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like cats? 76 KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean I don't think it's a good idea for us to hangout again. It's not you. You're fantastic. I just can't do this arranged marriage thing -- with anybody. KHADIJA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why did you meet me? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't my idea. KHADIJA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just really tired. Do you ever want to just be in a relationship so you can finally relax? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. You deserve better than me. KHADIJA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are always telling me what I deserve. It's bullshit. And stop being so sorry about everything. I'm gonna go. Khadija starts walking to her front door, then stops and turns back to Kumail. KHADIJA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know what? I watched the X-Files, like three whole episodes, and it's a bad show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, Terry, and Kumail sit. Beth and Terry with their laptops, Kumail with his iPhone. Each diligently typing. We see they're each looking things up on WebMD. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, they should call this website, "Everything is Cancer Dot Com". Everything you put in, it could be cancer. Hiccups could be cancer. Come on. You take the fun out of hiccups now. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know this is the 17th best hospital in Chicago? 77 TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Out of how many? BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but Northwestern's number one. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well how do they rate it? What's their methodology? BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Terry. But 17th is bad. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not great, unless the sample size is, you know, that all depends. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, look at the comments. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is why I don't want to go online cause it's never good. You go online, they hated Forrest Gump. Frickin' best movie ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry talks on his cellphone and paces. Dr. Cunningham tracks him down. DR. CUNNINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry - Hi. Can we talk? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. DR. CUNNINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got the biopsy results. They are unfortunately inconclusive. We are concerned- Music drowns out the rest of their conversation as Terry looks increasingly distraught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry speaks with Beth and Kumail. 78 TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They couldn't find out what the disease was, or where the virus came from or the bacteria or whatever. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they took out the infection so it shouldn't matter? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, that's what I said but her vitals didn't normalize. And now they say that the infection is continuing to spread, it's in her kidneys. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the kidneys are so far from the lungs. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, it's an aggressive infection and they said what they gotta do now is figure out what this mystery disease actually is. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm calling Northwestern. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold on, hold on. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry! Goddammit! KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should talk about this-- BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --You shut up! I'm sick of this shit, Terry. We're getting her out of here! TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in the middle of the whole process of elimination. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're saying Northwestern can't take that information and continue the search? This place is a shithole. She looks towards the other people in the waiting room. BETH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Anna, could I have that? 79 She takes her bag from Anna. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you just stop for a second? They're the doctors. You act like you know what you're talking about. You don't. Beth searches in her bag. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't find my cellphone. You got a phone? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give her a phone. You don't need a phone. You don't need to call anybody right now. Kumail takes out his phone, hands it to Beth. She starts fiddling with it. TERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're doing it. They're the experts here, and I trust them. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's very nice. But I don't. Can you unlock that thing? Beth hands the phone back to Kumail, he unlocks it, hands it back. BETH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a reason why they're #17 and Northwestern's #1. And it's not because people trust them! TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh - you think that you're smarter than me because you say big sentences. Well you're not! Kumail is trying to give them space, unsure what to do. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I'm smarter than you! You just don't think you're as smart as I am! That's not my fault! TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. It's never your fault. Everything's my fault. 80 BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh there are some things that are definitely just your fault. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that's bullshit. You need to stop freaking out and calm down. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you need to stop being a coward. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greatest hits, coming back. You can stop, I'll replay the rest of this from memory. Kumail slips away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail looking at gift items.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail walks with a giant STUFFED GIRAFFE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail puts the STUFFED GIRAFFE by her bed. Nurse Judy smiles. NURSE JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're giraffe-ing it. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the biggest thing they had. I don't even know if she likes giraffes. We never talked about giraffes. Hey, do they know what they're doing? Cause they don't tell us anything. Like, Lyme Disease? You know the girl on The Real World had it? Did you guys look for that? NURSE JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we did. 81 KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know she gets hurt all the time? She messed up her ankle recently - could that be Lupus? NURSE JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail. We're looking into everything. We're not holding anything back from you. We're still just eliminating possibilities. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause Beth wants to move her to Northwestern. NURSE JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no. Emily should not be moved. The hospital will approve it because it'll get the liability off their hands, but we put her in a coma for a reason. To stabilize her. Moving her could be very dangerous. The infection could spread. Trust me she is fighting. And so are we. Kumail looks frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry balls up his coat to use as a pillow, trying to get comfortable. Kumail enters. TERRY sees him and sits up. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Terry. I was just talking to the nurse - You okay? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, of course. Totally fine. Terry's eyes are very puffy and red. TERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth went to Emily's, so I'm gonna wait here until they kick me out. Keep an eye on her. Long pause. Terry and Kumail staring at one another. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you wanna crash at my place? 82 TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the golf channel? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't funny, right? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that was a serious question. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get the fuck out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail and Terry walk in. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is the place. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow...this place is terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail and Terry lay on separate air mattresses. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey I talked to Nurse Judy, and she was saying that moving Emily could be a bad idea. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she said it could be dangerous. Terry listens but doesn't respond. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like... TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Yeah. I hear you. I'd give anything to trade places with Emily. Being a parent, it's a nightmare. Loving somebody this much sucks. 83 KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Kumail's not sure what to say. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I guess you've noticed some tension between Beth and me. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. That's none of my business. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well, it's there. Big time. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting really late. We should go to sleep. Kumail turns off the light. A beat of quiet in the dark. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cheated on her. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuuuuck. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. It was just a one night stand. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We met at some bar in Cincinnati. They have these teacher conferences. Who goes to a math conference to get laid? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Math teachers? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think I was depressed, that's what it was. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Let's talk about it tomorrow. Get a full night's sleep. Catch up fresh in the- TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just smelled so good. It was horrible too. As soon as I was finished. As soon as I'd finished, I was like, what did you fucking do?! What did you just do?! (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 TERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do?! You know that moment of clarity you get right after an orgasm? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Beth right away. I had to. She was devastated. Now she hates me. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She might be mad at you, but she doesn't hate you. You should've heard the way she was talking about you. Hey, can I ask you something? Why did you tell her? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I had to. I'm no good with guilt. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you guys talk about it? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore. She said she forgave me, but no. She hasn't. Let me give you some advice Kumail. You're going to know the woman you want to spend the rest of your life with when you cheat on her. When you cheat on her and you just feel like shit. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, to fully know I love someone, I have to cheat on them? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out loud it sounds stupid. Yeah, that's terrible advice. Terry is clearly fraught. TERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love isn't easy. That's why they call it love. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really get that either. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I thought I could just start saying something and something smart would come out. 85

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail wakes up. Terry is gone. There is a note. "Headed to the hospital. See you there - Terry."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail pulls on his shoes as Chris exits the bathroom. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey did you see Terry? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I heard him leave this morning. I'm going to Sevies. You want anything? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm good, thank you. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want a hot dog or nothing? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude it's 8:30 in the morning. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, no hot dog. Chris opens the door to leave as Azmat and Sharmeen enter. SHARMEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just spoke to Khadija's parents. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? SHARMEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you, Kumi? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing is wrong with me. I'm sorry- SHARMEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry? That's all you have to say? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't that into her. 86

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Into her"? Do you know how difficult it is to get an appointment with her? She is in very high demand.

dialogues.speaker: KUMAIL
dialogues.text: Okay. So?

dialogues.speaker: SHARMEEN
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we please talk about this another time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, Kumi. We will talk about this now. We have sacrificed everything for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have left our family. We have left our home. I have missed the birth of my sister's daughter. I have not seen my mother for fifteen years. Your father, he had to do his graduate school. Again. He had to give exams. Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in my mid 50's. They were in 20s. They used to call me Father Time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that. I really appreciate everything you did for me, but can we talk about this another time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumi, if you don't want to be a lawyer, fine. If you want to do the stand-up comedy and embarrass us as a family, fine. There is only one thing that we have ever asked from you: that you be a good Muslim and that you marry a Pakistani girl. That is it, one thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something that has never made sense to me? Why did you bring me here if you wanted me to not have an American life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 87 KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We come here but we pretend like we're still back there? That's so stupid! AZMAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you talk to your mother like that! KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't care what I think. You just want me to follow the rules. But the rules don't make sense to me. I don't pray. I don't. I haven't prayed in years. I just go down there and I play video games. AZMAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe in Allah? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what I believe, Dad! I don't know. And I can't marry someone you find for me. SHARMEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why not? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm in love with someone. I am. Her name is Emily and she's gonna be a therapist. And right now she's very sick but I couldn't tell you that. It makes me so sad that I couldn't tell you any of that. I really appreciate everything you've done for me. I truly, truly do. And I know Islam has been really good for you, it has made you good people, but I don't know what I believe. I just need to figure it out on my own. SHARMEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not my son. Sharmeen turns her back on Kumail and heads towards the door. AZMAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumi, you're being selfish. You're not thinking about us. You're not thinking about Khadija. In fact you're not even thinking about that girl that you are in love with. You think American Dream is just about doing whatever you want and not thinking about other people? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 88 AZMAT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong! You are wrong! Sharmeen and Azmat leave. Chris comes back in. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... I never went to the store. I was just listening at the door. My mom kicked me out for dealing weed at sixteen, so I get it man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail walks in. He's had a rough morning. Terry and Beth are signing forms. Kumail approaches Terry. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, so when are we going to talk to Beth about what we talked about? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna move her. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What are you talking about? You fucking caved? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't cave. I don't cave. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. I know you don't cave. You're great. But we talked about this last night. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. We're moving her. She's right. Terry walks towards Beth as Kumail follows. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No. I told you what the nurse said. Hey Beth, the nurse told me that moving Emily could be a very bad idea. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Northwestern told us it could be very good. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they don't see her. This nurse sees her and she told me herself. 89 TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. They don't need to see her. Beth and Terry gather their things to leave, and Kumail grabs a form out of Terry's hand to stop him. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not okay. There. I got it! TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a map of the garage. Beth and Terry begin to walk down the hall. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait! Do you want to be responsible? She could die! Beth stops. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail, we're responsible for her no matter what. We're her parents. Now I'm sorry, we're moving her. They head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail pulls up in his car & talks to the DRIVE THRU box. STU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Quick'n Hot. May I take your order please? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, um can I get a burger with 4 slices of cheese. STU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four burgers. Anything else sir? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. One burger with four slices of cheese. Silence. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One burger with four- 90 STU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. We can't do that. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just put 4 slices of cheese on a burger. STU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't do that. There's no button - KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is this "we", man? Who the fuck is this "we"? It's me and you. We're just people. Fucking listen to me. Fuck this corporate entity. Put four slices of cheese on THE FUCKING BURGER. Silence. STU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't do that. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck, you fucking idiot? Kumail gets out of the car, runs to the pick up window. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look at me. Cause I'm a human being. You're a human being. Look at me. Look me in the eyes when you fuck me! Look at me. PLEASE! STU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today's my first day. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! Kumail turns to the garbage can nearby and just starts pulling garbage out. He locks eyes with Stu. STU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just ring you up for four burgers. STU looks down and starts typing. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. 91 STU (un-emotional)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want any fries or drink with that? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take four fries. I'm sorry. Kumail begins to put the trash back in the trash can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked, Kumail sits scarfing down burgers and fries. He gets a text from Chris: "Where are you? You're up in
KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail enters. Big crowd. Mary's on stage. Chris runs up. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man, Montreal finals. You ready? Oh wait, are you getting all dark and moody before your set? Yeah, punish yourself like a nasty little baby. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not in the mood. Okay Chris? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you in the mood. Kumail walks towards CJ and Sam. CHRIS (CONT'D) (to everyone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you all in the mood. CJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does everybody say the same fucking thing? Yeah, I'm doing great. 92 CJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, all right dude. I'm just checking. Dodd runs up to Kumail. DODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck've you been, man? You're on next! Dodd runs off. On stage, Mary is doing well. Kumail's phone rings. It's Terry. Kumail hesitates. Then answers. We see Kumail's face. He doesn't say anything. On stage - Mary finishes her act. We hear Terry's voice on the call. TERRY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail, it's Terry. Listen, we're not moving here. The doctors, they said.. We don't hear the rest of the call. DODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This next performer, my man, Mr. Kumail Nanjiani! Kumail is dazed. We see Bob Dalavan in the audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail slowly walks up to the stage. He stands there silently, looking at the audience. Then, finally... KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you guys heard of this new drug cocktail called cheese? Like that's the name of it, it's called cheese. I saw all these news reports, and they were like, there's a new drug, it's called cheese. Everyone's doing it in the Midwest, kids are doing it. Titters. Barely anything. Bob Dalavan not laughing. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just really hard to do stand-up comedy when your girlfriend is in a coma. The audience laughs nervously. 93 KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not quite sure what part you're laughing at. They say she's fighting, but she doesn't look like she's fighting. She looks like she's just laying there. I said horrible things to her. I hurt her. She loves birds. Like she gets excited every time she sees a bird. She's like, look at this, it's a bird. And I'm always like, yeah, they're all over the place, they're birds. But she likes that bird. Every bird she sees, she sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her dad just called and said that they can't transfer her because the infection has reached her heart. Which means... (realizing for the 1st time)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She could die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's darker, less clinical-feeling at night in Emily's room. She's still the same, the beeping is the same, but there's something almost holy feeling in the room at night. Kumail sits quietly talking to her. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if you can hear me or not, but it would be really good if you pulled through. If you have to go, you can go, but it would be really great if you stayed. And I'm really sorry about what I did - Kumail continues to quietly talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail wakes up in his filthy car the next morning to a text from Terry: "Please come right away".

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOSPITAL WAITING ROOM- DAY
dialogues.text: Kumail walks through the hallway. 94

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks inside the room. Emily is awake, surrounded by her parents and some doctors. Kumail watches through the window. Emily is groggy. The respirator is gone. Beth and Terry talk to her. She seems upset, can't talk. Kumail wants to go in but doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: INT. EMILY'S ICU ROOM- DAY
dialogues.text: Beth sits on Emily's bed. Terry, Dr. Cunningham, and Nurse Judy stand to the side. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom. You're getting your tears all over me. When am I gonna be able to feel my face? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave us quite a scare there, Scout. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. I call you that all the time. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not since I was a grown up. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've called you that your whole life! Nurse Judy holds up a CUP for Emily to sip from. Emily spits out the liquid. NURSE JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry hon. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that crap? NURSE JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to thicken your liquids for a bit. Your esophagus isn't strong enough to swallow yet. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That shit tastes like semen. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice for a father to hear. 95 DR. CUNNINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't have any social inhibitions until the anesthetic wears off. Nurse Judy holds the cup for Emily again, and she sips. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does! Seriously, Mom. You should try this. Emily tries to grab the cup herself. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh wait a minute, honey! Emily drops the cup. She's very upset. Beth comforts her. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, come on. They'll charge us forty eight dollars for it, don't worry about it. Kumail walks in. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here? KUMAIL (to Beth and Terry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't heard her voice in a while. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been here the whole time. DR. CUNNINGHAM (to Beth and Terry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I speak with you both outside? Dr Cunningham motions for them to join her in the hall. BETH (to Emily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, we'll be right outside. Terry and Beth and leave with Dr. Cunningham. Kumail approaches Emily. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. 96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cunningham speaks with Terry and Beth. DR. CUNNINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily has a rare condition called Adult Onset Still's disease. Kumail mentioned Emily's hurt ankle and the swelling still hadn't gone down even after several days in bed, which is strange. Still's disease is when the body thinks healthy tissue is an infection so it tries to fight it. It's like a big biological misunderstanding. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. DR CUNNINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gave her anti-inflammatories and she stabilized within hours. She's gonna take time to recover but she'll be fine. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail speaks with Emily. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was visiting someone down the hall and I was like, I'll just pop in and say hi to Emily. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm joking, I was here for you. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an asshole and I don't like you. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not an asshole. I'm really not. 97 EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're an asshole. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a lot of drugs in you so you're not thinking as clearly. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw dog. I'm not joking. You're not funny to me. You just make me sad. You make me sad inside of my heart, and it makes me sad to look at you. So I think you should probably go. Just go and tell my mom I want her. Kumail doesn't know what to say. EMILY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you please get my mom? Kumail nods and heads out to the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail goes up to Beth and Terry. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily wants to see you. Beth goes back inside Emily's room. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna head out. I don't think I should be here. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Kumail. Here's the thing. Your living condition is a potential health risk and you're not that funny. But.... you're probably not suited to do anything else either so that's troublesome-- KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really made it sound like you were going to say something positive there. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I did, didn't I? You know I know the good stuff. You know how I feel. I gotta get in there. 98 Terry heads back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry walks in. Beth sits on Emily's bed as Kumail watches through the window. Beth notices Kumail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth comes outside into the hallway. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you gonna hang around Chicago for a while? BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. She's got physical therapy. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever think you'd be excited to have your daughter go through physical therapy? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so strange that we could go through one of the most intense experiences of our lives together and just never see each other again. Beth puts her hands on Kumail's face. She looks at him. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. But I hope not. They smile. Kumail walks out of the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail backstage with other comics. Chris is on-stage. Kumail sits on a chair going over his notes. CJ and Mary walk up to him. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi little sad man. Mopey boy. We have something to tell you. We are moving to New York. And we want you to come with us. 99

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta do it. It's going to suck at first but we'll have each other and maybe eventually get paid to write jokes. It's gonna be the best. Come on dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to come. I know you did not get Montreal and that is only because you did one of the worst sets I've ever seen in my goddamn life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was nonsense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A living disgrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would call it shit, but I would be worried that I'd be insulting actual shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was so bone-chilling to me, I thought a ghost had passed right through me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have to keep going over how bad the set was. I saw their faces and the noises they didn't make.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt one of my eggs die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't that happen every month?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens every month, Kumail, but I don't always feel it and go, ohhhhh. And that's what you made me do. I'm packing my things up and I'm moving to New York, and guess what, baby? You're coming with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Chris? 100 Chris performs on stage. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will be fine. CJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not enough room in the car, probably. We leave in a week, all right? And I already called shotgun Chicago to Pittsburgh. Do not fuck this up. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your destiny awaits! CJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This will be the biggest move of your life. Other than the one from Pakistan.

dialogues.speaker: INT. EMILY'S APARTMENT- DAY
dialogues.text: A "WELCOME HOME" banner hangs. Balloons. Beth, Terry, and EMILY'S FRIENDS are chatting. Emily sits on the couch chatting, a CANE by her side. Terry taps on a cup. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, clink clink! Thank you everybody for coming. I just wanted to say a couple of words here. Emily clocks Kumail as he WALKS IN holding a large bag. EMILY (leans over to Beth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is Kumail here? BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause he was there the whole time. I invited the nurses, I invited him. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, come on up here. I wanna say something. Emily stands up and makes her way to Terry. TERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily successfully peeled an orange this morning. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 101 TERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a clementine, full disclosure, it's those little ones that a baby monkey could peel, but she did it. And that's all, thank you everybody. Kumail finally approaches Emily. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I like your cane. I've heard pimpin' ain't easy. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, can we talk for a second? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk in. Lots of jackets on the bed. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I've been collecting some things that are important to me and I wanted to show them to you. I call this my bag of devotion. Kumail presents the BIG BAG and starts to take items out. He holds up a bunch of HOSPITAL PASSES. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all the visitor passes from when I visited you when you were in the- He holds up some TICKET STUBS. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the ticket stubs from when your parents came to see me perform and I realized how great they are, and how great you are, and how great honesty is. He holds up a JAR FULL OF ASHES. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do? Did you cremate someone? 102 KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the ashes of all the Pakistani women - not the women - the pictures of the Pakistani women. I thought this was a good idea, but it feels a little stupid. Kumail puts the items down and kneels before Emily. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I was a terrible boyfriend. But I've changed. And I am the person you need me to be. I really am. So, will you take me back? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail, I'm really glad that you went through this experience, but you have to understand that all that happened while I was asleep. Like you felt one way a few weeks ago and now you're saying you feel the total opposite way and the only thing that's changed is that I was in a coma. Honestly, I look at all of this, and I just think, I can't do it again. I can't be the reason that you don't have a family. It just feels totally different now. And I can't do that again. Do you understand? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Kumail packs up his bag of devotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Kumail drives a passenger around. -- Kumail cleans his room. -- Sharmeen, Azmat, Naveed, and Fatima have a family dinner. Kumail's not there. -- Emily does physical therapy with Beth and Terry. -- Kumail drives passengers around. -- Emily, Beth, and Terry eat take out together. -- Kumail at the theater works on his one-man show. 103 -- Emily in bed with Beth sleeping next to her. Terry by himself on the sofa. -- Kumail and CJ put up fliers for Kumail's one man show. -- Kumail makes a Facebook page for his one man show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail enters the dining room without knocking on the door. Azmat, Sharmeen, Naveed, and Fatima are eating dinner. Kumail joins them. We see he has another LARGE BAG. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma. Dad. Fatima. Bhai. There's no plate. Oh I forgot. I've decided I won't let you kick me out of the family. Since I am a member of the family, it would stand to reason that I would get a vote in whether or not I get kicked out, and that vote would have to be unanimous. Standard parliamentary procedure. So all those in favor of not kicking Kumail out of the family, raise your hand. Kumail raises his hand. Everyone else stares silently. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Motion to kick Kumail out of the family, denied. So you guys can just talk to me. Everyone is silent. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you're giving me the silent treatment. I figured that was what was going to happen. I have a solution. Kumail pulls out cue cards from his bag and shows them. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Hi. How are you?" It's just a real basic one. "Pass the salt." Practical. "Always with the comedy." Mom, made that one specially for you. "Kumail, how did you become so much more handsome than your brother Naveed?" 104 NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Naveed and Azmat exchange a look. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I admit this one is designed to stir up some controversy. "It's interesting how you can't really kick someone out of your family because they'll always be your family." I agree with that one. It's a good one. So, I'm gonna leave these here for you. Kumail leaves the cards on the dining table. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I lied about the girls and the LSAT and all of that. That was wrong. And one more thing: I'm moving to New York to pursue stand-up, but I am not leaving this family. Kumail leaves. Eye contact around the table.

dialogues.speaker: INT. EMILY'S APARTMENT- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Emily on her bed. She impulsively Googles Kumail and finds his MONTREAL AUDITION, which is described as "WORST BOMB IN HISTORY!!!" She plugs her headphones in and watches a beat. KUMAIL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents want me to get arrange married. Or as it's called in Pakistan, romance! Earlier today, I told them everything. I told them about my life. I told them about Emily. They kicked me out of the family. I may never talk to them again. So that happened - KNOCK on the door. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? BETH (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come in? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. 105 Beth enters. Emily closes her laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear you and Dad are just like my freshman year roommate, but instead of boning random dudes, you're just parenting all the time. All over the place. In every room of the house. Including right next to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know what? You're strong and you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marquee says "KUMAIL NANJIANI: CITIZEN". People filing into the theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mid-show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we'd go to the mosque and hear graphic details of religious people being killed 1400 years ago. I mean like Tarantino-esque details. And everyone would be crying, like competing to see who could cry the hardest. And I could never cry. And I was like, what is wrong with me? Am I broken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 106 KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only time I've cried that much is when I watched the first 15 minutes of Up. This is a picture of me and my mother. I'm seven years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is in the bathroom while Terry stands in the kitchen drinking a glass of water. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know people talk about New York water but Chicago water is very underrated, I think. It's good. Emily comes into the living room. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey guys, I think I might just pop out for a bit. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By yourself? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, just hop around the block, maybe get some frozen yogurt. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Can you do it, can you walk by yourself? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Dad. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have fun. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you feel a coma coming on, call us. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, it's too soon. I love you, I'll see you in the morning. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you, bye. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have fun. 107 EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got your phone? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail is with Naveed in the empty theatre. Naveed wears sunglasses. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you liked it, huh? NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I mean, yeah. Emily enters hesitantly. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi... KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in the neighborhood and I saw that you were gonna be here so I thought I'd come say hi. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look great. How's your blood oxygen level? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well within range. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice. They stand there. It's tense. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, this is my brother, Naveed. 108 EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm Emily. NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard lots about you. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so good to finally meet you. (to Kumail)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's actually something I wanted to tell you. Naveed clocks the tension between them. NAVEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well I'm going to just... goodbye. Naveed slips out as Emily and Kumail stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry lies on the pull out sofa. Just before Beth gets to Emily's room she stops. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you warm enough? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. I've got my two pairs of socks on. She smiles, walks into Emily's bedroom. Terry gets under the covers. Beth reemerges and approaches his couch-bed. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind? TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... no... Beth gets under the covers with him. They snuggle. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad we're going home tomorrow. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. See? I should have brushed my teeth. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it. 109

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail and Emily sit on the bed from his show together. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When something like this happens, there's this sort of expectation that you're going to have this completely new lease on life and feel totally different about everything. Like cherish every sunrise. And for the most part I just feel like, ugh I can't get up that early. I'm sorry, I feel like I've been talking about myself so much. Are you doing a lot of stand-up? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I bombed my Montreal Comedy Festival audition, like horrifically. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the video. It wasn't great. I'll be honest with you, it wasn't great. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there was a lot I liked. Like a lot I liked. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm moving to New York. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Mary and CJ and I are just gonna drive out. We have a place already. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do you leave? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next weekend. This kinda hits them both like a ton of bricks. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so excited for you. That is great. I think you are going to do so great in New York. 110 KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you going to say? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you were going to say something to me. What was it? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, just that I wanted to thank you. My parents told me everything you did for me and I feel like the last time we spoke I didn't properly thank you so- KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Totally fine. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should probably go. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you wanna call an Uber? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm gonna walk actually. This has been really great. Okay, bye. They smile at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CJ, Mary, Kumail, and Chris are packing BOXES into a car. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene is gonna be so different with you guys gone. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should... come out... CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. I'm good here. I'm gonna miss you. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna miss you. Kumail and Chris hug. 111 CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here, you assholes. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, you big dummy. Chris hugs Mary. Kumail is distracted as a CAR pulls up nearby. Kumail stares at it. After a beat, Kumail's dad Azmat pops out and walks up to Kumail. AZMAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are still kicked out of the family, but because we did not get a proper chance to say bye to you... Your mother is so angry with you. She is not going to get out of the car. She's not even going to look at you. And I don't believe you kept so much secret from me, your father. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. AZMAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. She asked me to give this to you. Azmat hands Kumail a TUPPERWARE CONTAINER. AZMAT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biryani. For your trip. Your favorite. She made it herself specially for you with extra potatoes. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you Ma. Kumail looks to the car. Sharmeen is in the backseat. She averts her gaze when she sees him looking at her. KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she okay? AZMAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now? No. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll miss you. AZMAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am forbidden from hugging you. So. It was nice to have you as my son. Goodbye forever. And do me a favor, when you reach New York, just text us and tell us that you've reached safely, okay? 112 Kumail nods. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, can I ask you something? When you and Mom went on your first date, what movie did you see? AZMAT (thinks, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satte pe Satta. Azmat hums a snippet of a song from the movie. AZMAT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her favorite song. Why are you asking? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just curious. Azmat nods and heads back to the car. He gets in and drives off. Kumail gets in the car with CJ and Mary and they drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shots of NYC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumail performs comedy in front of a room full of NEW YORK HIPSTERS. He's killing. CJ and Mary are there too. Kumail takes a sip of water. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the first time I came to America, I was fourteen and I was just visiting my uncle in New York and it just happened to be Thanksgiving. On my first day in America, my uncle took me to the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade and I was like, this is every day in America! As advertised. Every day they have a party celebrating Garfield. No day has lived up to that day. So I was lying to my parents, I was telling them I was gonna be a lawyer. And they're very disappointed cause they wanted me to be a doctor. And you guys are like, why didn't you just tell them that you wanted to be a doctor? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 113 KUMAIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a lie anyway. And I'm like, well it has to be believable. If I told them I want to be a doctor, they'd be like, "bullshit." If I say lawyer, they're like, "oh, ok, that's something." Cause there's a strict hierarchy: doctor, engineer, lawyer, hundreds of jobs, ISIS, then comedian. A very loud WHOOOOO emanates from the crowd. Kumail looks out to the crowd to see Emily, beaming at him. He is taken aback. KUMAIL (CONT'D) (stumbling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhh. I'm sorry. It's very rude to heckle comedians. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that wasn't a heckle. I just kind of woo-hooed you. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well see that's a common misconception. Heckling doesn't have to be negative. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if I was like, oh my god, you're amazing in bed! That would be a heckle? KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and now you're getting more laughs than me, and I don't like that. Do you want to come up, do my job? Are you from out of town, m'am? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chicago. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh Windy City. And what brings you to New York? EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to see someone. KUMAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And have you seen him? Or her, I mean I don't know what your deal is. EMILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I've seen him. They smile at each other. 114
